content.description:
Urbs erat occiduisocciduus, -a, -um, adj.: western procul hinc notissima terris
indigenisindigena, -ae, f.: native, born an Indigenous person quondamquondam, adv.: once multos dominatadominor, -ari, -atus (+ abl.): to rule over per annos,
nunc vero HispaniHispanus, -a, -um, adj.: Spanish, populis MavorteMavors, -tis, m.: Mars (the god of war), war subactissubigo, -igere, -egi, -actum: to conquer,
sceptrasceptrum, -i, n. = imperium, -i tenent, summaque urbem dicionedicio, -onis, f.: authority gubernantguberno, -are: to rule.
content.question: In the passage, nunc vero Hispani sceptra tenentÂ is translated

choices.label: now in fact the Spanish hold power
now in fact they hold the Spanish nation
in fact the Spanish already had an nation
in fact they already held power over the Spanish

content.answer: now in fact the Spanish hold power

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2
